DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Green tea extract contain ingredient ( catechin ) may lower risk breast cancer . PURPOSE : This phase II trial study well green tea extract work prevent breast cancer compare placebo postmenopausal woman high breast density . The investigator hypothesize green tea consumption reduces breast cancer risk , effect see primarily woman low-activity COMT genotype . The investigator test evaluate effect green tea extract breast cancer biomarkers include mammographic density , plasma insulin-like growth factor 1 ( IGF-1 ) , IGF bind protein 3 ( IGFBP-3 ) , estrone , estradiol , androstenedione , sex hormone bind globulin ( SHBG ) , urinary estrogen metabolite plasma F2-isoprostanes .
DOC.brief_title: Green Tea Reduction Breast Cancer Risk
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : 1 . Primary : 1.1 To determine effect green tea extract consumption ( contain 800 mg EGCG per day ) 12 month follow recognize biomarkers breast cancer risk : 1 . Mammographic density 2 . Circulating concentration insulin-like growth factor 1 ( IGF-1 ) IGF bind protein 3 ( IGFBP-3 ) 3 . Circulating concentration reproductive hormone ( estrone , estradiol , androstenedione ) sex hormone bind globulin ( SHBG ) 1.2 To determine effect COMT genotype green tea extract effect describe . 2 . Secondary : 2.1 To determine effect green tea extract consumption ( contain 800 mg EGCG per day ) 12 month follow hypothesized biomarkers breast cancer risk : 1 . Urinary estrogen metabolite ( estrone , estradiol , 2-hydroxy , 4-hydroxy , 2-methoxy , 4-methoxy metabolite , estriol , 16- hydroxyestrone ) 2 . Circulating concentration F-2 isoprostanes , recognize biomarker systemic oxidative stress 2.2 To determine effect COMT genotype green tea extract effect describe . 2.3 To determine effect COMT genotype catechin metabolism excretion , measure circulate urinary concentration .
DOC.criteria: Signed informed consent Healthy postmenopausal woman age 5070 year `` Heterogeneously dense '' ( 5175 % glandular ) `` extremely dense '' ( > 75 % glandular ) breast Willing avoid consumption green tea 1 year Positive serological marker hepatitis B hepatitis C infection Elevated level liver enzymes Recent ( within 6 mo ) current hormone hormone modification therapy , include systemic hormone replacement therapy , SERMS aromatase inhibitor Current smoker cigarettes tobacco product BMI < 19 > 40 kg/m2 Weight change > 10 lb previous year History breast cancer proliferative breast disease Regular consumption > 7 alcoholic drinks/wk Regular consumption green tea ( > 1 cup/wk ) Recent ( within 6 mo ) current use chemopreventive agent tamoxifen , raloxifene aromatase inhibitor Participation weight loss weight gain study Currently take Methotrexate Enbrel History ovarian cancer Any form cancer last 5 year Presence implant
